str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
From the same as klesis; invited, i.e. Appointed, or, a saint.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To rail off, separate, place apart. From apo and horizo; to set off by boundary, i.e. limit, exclude, appoint, etc.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
